docs.lead_paragraph: ''Living Quarters'' by Brian Friel, the Irish writer whose plays include ''Philadelphia, Here I Come,'' makes its American debut at the Vineyard Theater, 309 East 26th Street, starting with previews tonight at 8. In this work, a general returning home as a hero learns that his young wife has had an affair with his son by an earlier marriage. The consequences are shattering -but the family gets a chance to relive the preceding events in hope of bringing about a different ending. The director is Susan Einhorn. Tickets are $8 ($7 for students and over-65's). Reservations: 683-0696. TAP THEATER IN CHELSEA The choreographer Gail Conrad and her Tap Dance Theater tell stories with their feet. They are offering a premiere tonight at the Dance Theater Workshop, 219 West 19th Street - a science-fiction melodrama called ''Mission,'' about a spy sent to infiltrate an island country. It has original music by Walter Hackett Jr., lifesize, cut-out figures and portable houses. Two other Conrad tap-dance works, ''The Racket'' and ''Love Street,'' are also on the program. Tickets are $6. Reservations recommended: 924-0077.
